verses.kjv: Moreover take thou up a lamentation for the princes of Israel,
verses.ct: "Now sing a funeral song for the rulers of Israel.

verses.kjv: And say, What is thy mother? A lioness: she lay down among lions, she nourished her whelps among young lions.
verses.ct: Say: 'What was your mother? A lioness! She settled among lions and raised her cubs surrounded by young lions.

verses.kjv: And she brought up one of her whelps: it became a young lion, and it learned to catch the prey; it devoured men.
verses.ct: She raised one of her cubs, and he grew into a young lion. He learned to tear apart prey and devoured people.

verses.kjv: The nations also heard of him; he was taken in their pit, and they brought him with chains unto the land of Egypt.
verses.ct: The surrounding nations heard about him. He was caught in their trap, and they dragged him away with hooks to the land of Egypt.

verses.kjv: Now when she saw that she had waited, and her hope was lost, then she took another of her whelps, and made him a young lion.
verses.ct: When she realized her waiting was pointless and her hopes were crushed, she took another of her cubs and trained him to become a young lion.

verses.kjv: And he went up and down among the lions, he became a young lion, and learned to catch the prey, and devoured men.
verses.ct: He prowled among the lions and grew into a powerful young lion. He learned to tear apart prey and devoured people.

verses.kjv: And he knew their desolate palaces, and he laid waste their cities; and the land was desolate, and the fulness thereof, by the noise of his roaring.
verses.ct: He ravaged their fortresses and destroyed their cities. The land and everyone in it was terrified by the sound of his roaring.

verses.kjv: Then the nations set against him on every side from the provinces, and spread their net over him: he was taken in their pit.
verses.ct: Then nations from the surrounding regions came against him. They spread their net over him, and he was caught in their trap.

verses.kjv: And they put him in ward in chains, and brought him to the king of Babylon: they brought him into holds, that his voice should no more be heard upon the mountains of Israel.
verses.ct: They put him in a cage with chains and brought him to the king of Babylon. They locked him away in a fortress so that his roar would never again be heard on the mountains of Israel.

verses.kjv: Thy mother is like a vine in thy blood, planted by the waters: she was fruitful and full of branches by reason of many waters.
verses.ct: Your mother was like a vine planted by the water, in your own bloodline. She was fruitful and full of branches because of the abundant water.

verses.kjv: And she had strong rods for the sceptres of them that bare rule, and her stature was exalted among the thick branches, and she appeared in her height with the multitude of her branches.
verses.ct: She grew strong branches fit to be rulers' scepters. She towered high among the thick foliage, standing tall and visible with her many branches.

verses.kjv: But she was plucked up in fury, she was cast down to the ground, and the east wind dried up her fruit: her strong rods were broken and withered; the fire consumed them.
verses.ct: But she was ripped up in fury and thrown to the ground. The east wind dried up her fruit. Her strong branches were snapped off and withered, and fire consumed them.

verses.kjv: And now she is planted in the wilderness, in a dry and thirsty ground.
verses.ct: Now she has been transplanted into the wilderness, into dry and parched ground.

verses.kjv: And fire is gone out of a rod of her branches, which hath devoured her fruit, so that she hath no strong rod to be a sceptre to rule. This is a lamentation, and shall be for a lamentation.
verses.ct: Fire has spread from one of her own branches and devoured her fruit, so that no strong branch remains to serve as a ruler's scepter.' This is a funeral song, and it will continue to be sung as one."
